Meatball Surgery- Dr Kohak and adding Traits
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance 2 Archive (GameBoy Advance): The Hospital (Illnesses/Characteristics): Meatball Surgery- Dr Kohak and adding Traits
By GoldenBoy on Tuesday, December 3, 2002 - 01:04 pm:

Once you beat the Emperor Cup and get Master
Breeder, a LOT of things happen. One of them is
pretty cool.
Every July in the Hospital an unliscensed Dr
Kohak shows up and will perform surgery to ADD a
trait to your monster. It costs 20k gold but I
think its worth it. I saved before going and
tried it 10-15 times with my Henger. I feel
there's a predertmined list of chars for each
monster, eventually I took Hi Speed and haven't
regretted it.

One last note, Normal services aren't available
in the Hosp until after you either get the
surgery or the end of the month.

By GoldenBoy on Wednesday, December 4, 2002 - 12:34 pm:

Addendum: its not just in July but theres a
chance whenever you go on wk1

By GoldenBoy on Friday, December 13, 2002 - 06:19 am:

Surgery doesn't result in a lifespan hit. Tested
with a Mech Hare with 2m life remaining. No
change in warnings before/after surgery.

Getting the doctor can happen anytime like the
peddler.

By nikolace on Tuesday, December 17, 2002 - 02:48 am:

I had two surgeries to remove traits to make room for better ones on my garu/sp and not two months later he started training half as well as normal and he was only twoyears two months...his parents trained well until around three and a half years, they lived until 4 y 9 m and 5y 0 m.

By GoldenBoy on Tuesday, December 17, 2002 - 08:39 am:

a) I'm talking about surgery to add not remove.

b) You'd notice a change immediately right away
if it was the fault of surgery. I use surgery to
remove all the time and have had no problems like
you mention.

If you care to test surgery to remove and post
concrete results instead of anecdotal evidence go
ahead.

By Infernus on Monday, January 27, 2003 - 10:42 am:

GoldenBoy,you say there's a CHANCE whenever you go on week one,does this mean that it is still slightly random or what...?

By Thorr on Monday, January 27, 2003 - 10:48 am:

It's just like the town square. The game determines whether or not you will have an event there as soon as you go to town. So, if you want to try and force the event, save at the ranch at the beginning of the week. Then go to town and check the Hospital. If Dr. Kohak isn't there then you just reload, go back to town, and check again.

I have found that you can get it on any week, but he only stays until the end of the month.

-Thorr
